title: Superdoctor
author: Superdoctor
content: Last year I predicted Bitcoin will rise above the value at the start of the year and I was totally right about it, in April Bitcoin eventually reached a new all-time high price of $64k. Bitcoin added about 72% of its value as it  increased drastically before it eventually started falling back in May till September. I don’t really know how this year is going to turn out now because of the present dip. But I just hope it increases, that’s why I’ve been advising so many people  to hold their Bitcoins and even buy more now cause it will surely rise again.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: In the short term, no one can give an accurate prediction to what direction the market would take with any precision; it's just a gamble.In the longer term, I can speculate that Bitcoin would be much higher than it is now, within the next 1-10 year time period. The price increase could  be a 5×, 10×, 20× or more from now (I prefer to be conservative with my speculations). This long term potential for growth is what investors should target, and you will be bothered less by short term volatility.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: There is nothing bad to hold and enjoy the rise, even if the price of bitcoin is falling this present time, I will advise holders to remain holding because it will later pay out good. The market is favoring bitcoin upside, but we do not know what will be the next, the price may continue to increase, or maybe decrease further. I read in a news that bitcoin miners are not selling and if more people are not selling, this will favour bitcoin price to increase, but we are all just predicting the price, which will favour long term holders certainly.

comments.author: lalabotax
comments.body: There should be always some pumps after a series of dumps. But what price do you expect? If you want to take profits from your short-term holding, it is always possible. You can do it as long as you know a good time to buy (entry), then you sell (exit) once there is a pump. You need sufficient knowledge and experience to analyze when the right time for buying and selling. It doesn't depend on the early, middle, or end of the year but you can do it anytime. Sure, Bitcoin will always fluctuate, there should be a decrease and increase in Bitcoin price all year round.

comments.author: Captain Corporate
comments.body: Everyone is acting as if this is the easiest thing to do, and they are both right but also wrong. Realize that bitcoin will do whatever it wants to do, whatever "we" want it to do, there isn't really a secret to it, there isn't a solution to it, there isn't a prediction neither. If bitcoin goes up, we could see it go to 50k in a week, 100k in a month or so, its not impossible, so its never "too late", but if its not going to go up, it can stay at 20-30k range for another full year. So there isn't a reason why we should think we could figure it out, we can't. Just realize you can't, buy as many as you can afford, and wait until it inevitably goes up "eventually".

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: The news about Celsius going bankrupt and Russia getting anti-crypto again were supposed to cause more FUD, but the Bitcoin price actually went up a little bit, which is weird. I expect a global recession to strike in the second half of 2022. This means that the crypto winter would most likely continue for the next year and a half of maybe 2 years. The BTC price might increase temporarily to levels above 20K or even 25K, but there won't be enough bullish momentum to push the price up to 30K-40K. The greed and optimism on the crypto markets cannot reach the 2017 or 2021 levels. Just HODL and enjoy your life. There won't be any reason to keep an eye on the Bitcoin price everyday in the upcoming months.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: for those interested in the most efficient asic miners of bitmain145Thash at 5.4kw = $13,200 cost per btc at network hashrate of 210exa   158Thash at 5.4kw =$14,506 cost per btc at network hashrate of 210exa   this is because these particular units are using 'cheap' boards with higher nm chips meaning their boards are cheaper to make but the electric use is higher.. so they offer the hardware at only $2.2k-$3.8k per asic instead of the usual $11k-$15k thus making it cheap to buy an asic. which then makes the ROI and costs lower overallthis means on the most cheapest asic cost of mining, the lowest someone can acquire bitcoin for at a 4cent/kw electricis about $13k +these batches are releasing for delivery right now. so think of this as the 'bottom'becasue as they go online and start mining. hasrate goes up. the mining competition fight of bitcoin reward intensifies and the cost/price goes upalso other people with less efficient asics, more costly asics, and more costly electric. cant get bitcoin that cheap. and so the chance of the price dropping that low is low due to lack of these asics in the mining populationmany people with higher costs see that while the market price is ~$18k-$20k and their own mining cost is well over $20k. its just easier and cheaper to just buy bitcoin
